items.sentence: Tom almost always falls asleep at night hugging his teddy bear.
I\'m sorry, but I really don\'t have time to do that right now.
When I hear that song, I think about the place where I grew up.
Tom raised the crowbar intending to smash his attacker\'s head.
Tom said he\'s going to try something he has never done before.
Tom sat in the driver\'s seat and adjusted the rearview mirror.
If it had not been for the storm, I would have arrived earlier.
Tom asked Mary to wake him up in time to catch the first train.
Tom doesn\'t want to buy an expensive engagement ring for Mary.
Please don\'t say that you won\'t let Tom play with me anymore.
Tom opened the envelope, pulled out the letter and unfolded it.
Tom told Mary he was interested in buying one of her paintings.
Tom was in a hurry so he left his second cup of coffee undrunk.
Do you think Tom would like to go camping with us next weekend?
How long do you think that it would take you to paint my house?
Tom gets angry when people don\'t do what they say they\'ll do.
We have to figure out a way to get this job finished by Monday.
Tom hasn\'t heard anything from Mary for more than three years.
Tom might have visited Mary in Boston last week. I\'m not sure.
As I\'ve gotten older, my opinions on many things have changed.
